item.term: Early first millennium to the fourth century BC (predominance of Saba)
Fourth to first centuries BC (predominance of Qataban and Hadramawt, and their alliance with Main)
First century BC to early second century AD (alliances between the tribes of the high plateau and the ASA kingdoms)
Late second to late third centuries AD (wars among the Himyar, Saba and Hadramawt)
Fourth to sixth centuries AD (unification of Yemen under Himyarite rule)
It corresponds to the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans with sub-periods I-IV

And may he grant them 10.the first-fruits of the spring and autumn harvests in all of their val- 11.leys and their lands. And may 12.Taʾlab Riyāmum grant them the esteem and the 13.pleasure of their two lords, Yarīm ʾAymān 14.and Karibʾīl Watar, the two kings of Sabaʾ. 15.[And may] Taʾlab Riyām[um] keep them safe 16.[from] the enmity and hostility of any foe; and may he suppress 17.and destroy and subdue their enemies and their foes. 18.By Taʾlab Riyāmum.

...
... and their son Rafshān, of the lineage of
Sukhaymum, the leaders of the tribe of Sumʿay,
the third division of Hagarum, have dedicated to their patron
Taʾlab Riyāmum, Lord of Ra-
ḥībān, this statue for their well-being and the well-
being of their house of Raymān, and the well-being
of their tribal leader and of their tribe of Yarisum,
the third division of Hagarum. And may he grant them
the first-fruits of the spring and autumn harvests in all of their val-
leys and their lands. And may
Taʾlab Riyāmum grant them the esteem and the
pleasure of their two lords, Yarīm ʾAymān
and Karibʾīl Watar, the two kings of Sabaʾ.
And may Taʾlab Riyāmum keep them safe
from the enmity and hostility of any foe; and may he suppress
and destroy and subdue their enemies and their foes.
By Taʾlab Riyāmum.
